info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and northwestern Monroe Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorm near Blakeslee, or 9 miles west of Mount Pocono. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blakeslee, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Pocono Pines, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, Arrowhead Lake and Meckesville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 282 and 299. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3, and near mile marker 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
